SEARCH
Package main

Class GameManager

java.lang.Object
main.GameManager
public class GameManager extends Object
Game Manager class. The main class of the program. Contains and keeps track of the game logic. Game is played from this class.
Author:
Stephen Huang, Jasmine Ong

    • closeSetUpScreen

      public void closeSetUpScreen(SetupScreen setupWindow)
      Method to close the setup screen when ready. Will call refreshWeek() to prepare the first week of matches and market items. Launches the main screen to begin the game.
      Parameters:
      setupWindow - the setup screen

    • launchStadiumScreen

      public void launchStadiumScreen()
      Launches the Stadium screen where the player will be able to view and play matches.

    • closeStadiumScreen

      public void closeStadiumScreen(StadiumScreen stadiumWindow)
      Closes the stadium screen when it is no longer needed.
      Parameters:
      stadiumWindow - StadiumScreen

    • launchClubScreen

      public void launchClubScreen()
      Launches the Club screen where the player manages their team and inventory. Here, the player is able to designate athletes to a position in the starting lineup. Athletes can be benched or promoted.

    • closeClubScreen

      public void closeClubScreen(ClubScreen clubWindow)
      Closes the Club screen
      Parameters:
      clubWindow - ClubScreen

    • launchMarketScreen

      public void launchMarketScreen()
      Launches the Market screen where the player will be able to buy and sell purchasebles. Purchaseables include Athletes and consumable Items.

    • closeMarketScreen

      public void closeMarketScreen(MarketScreen marketWindow)
      Closes the Market screen and returns to the main menu.
      Parameters:
      marketWindow - MarketScreen

    • launchTrainingScreen

      public void launchTrainingScreen()
      When the player takes a bye to move onto the next week, they are given the option to train one of their Athletes.

    • closeTrainingScreen

      public void closeTrainingScreen(TrainingScreen trainingWindow)
      Closes the Training Screen.
      Parameters:
      trainingWindow - TrainingScreen

    • launchMarketSellScreen

      public void launchMarketSellScreen()
      The window of the Market that allows the player to sell instead of purchase items.

    • closeMarketSellScreen

      public void closeMarketSellScreen(MarketSellScreen marketSellWindow)
      Closes the market and returns to the main menu.
      Parameters:
      marketSellWindow - MarketSellScreen

    • launchInventoryScreen

      public void launchInventoryScreen(String originScreen)
      Launches the inventory screen which can be accessed from both the Market and the Club. As a result, it takes the parameter originScreen so it knows where to return to.
      Parameters:
      originScreen - the screen the inventory was accessed from

    • closeInventoryScreen

      public void closeInventoryScreen(InventoryScreen inventoryWindow, String origin)
      Thanks to the origin parameter, this method will open up the previous screen when the inventory the closes.
      Parameters:
      inventoryWindow - the inventory screen which displays the player's items
      origin - the screen that the inventory was accessed from

    • launchMatchScreen

      public void launchMatchScreen(Match match)
      Launch the match screen and calls run match to determine the outcome After the outcome is determined, the GameManager stores it for use in other methods.
      Parameters:
      match - the game being palyed

    • closeMatchScreen

      public void closeMatchScreen(MatchScreen matchWindow)
      Closes the match screen when the go back button is pressed.
      Parameters:
      matchWindow - the screen where matches are played.

    • launchEndScreen

      The end of the game

    • closeEndScreen

      public void closeEndScreen(EndScreen endWindow)
      Closes the final screen of the game
      Parameters:
      endWindow - EndScreen

    • setUpGame

      public void setUpGame(String name, int numWeeks, String difficultyChoice, List<Athlete> startAthletes, int teamCost)
      Method to set up the game. Gets the team name, number of weeks, difficulty, starting athletes, and money.
      Parameters:
      name - the team name chosen by the player.
      numWeeks - the length of the season in weeks.
      difficultyChoice - the player's chosen difficulty. This will affect starting money.
      startAthletes - the athletes available at setup.
      teamCost - the cost of that roster, this value is deducted from starting money.

    • takeBye

      public void takeBye()
      Method that handles transitioning between weeks It increments the week number, Raises the stats for athlete generation, resulting in

    • noSpecialChar

      public boolean noSpecialChar(String teamName)
      Method that can be used to check for (lack of) special characters. If team name matches regex [a-zA-Z], then it will not have special characters.
      Parameters:
      teamName - String
      Returns:
      boolean for match

    • changeMoneyEarned

      public void changeMoneyEarned(int earned)
      Increases the total for money earnt from matches. This is being done so we can show it in the end summary.
      Parameters:
      earned - int the amount to increase total by

    • getMoneyEarned

      public int getMoneyEarned()
      Returns the total amount of money earned from matches. This will be called in the end summary
      Returns:
      totalEarned int

    • getMoneyString

      public String getMoneyString()
      Method returns the player's money in a more suitable format as a string. For example 5,000,000 intead of 5000000
      Returns:
      String for money format

    • getMoneyFormat

      public String getMoneyFormat(int amount)
      Same as above but instead of the team money, it takes an amount as a parameter. Allowing it to be used in other cases.
      Parameters:
      amount - int
      Returns:
      String for money format

      public int getSeasonPoints()

    • updateSeasonPoints

      public void updateSeasonPoints(int points)
      Updates the season point count by the param points Receive extra 5 points per win on Hard difficulty!
      Parameters:
      points - int

    • getMainRoster

      public ArrayList<Athlete> getMainRoster()
      Returns the starting lineup of Athletes, the 5 players that have positions assigned. These are the players who will compete in matches.
      Returns:
      ArrayList of Athlete objects, representing main roster of players

    • getReserveRoster

      public ArrayList<Athlete> getReserveRoster()
      Returns the reserve roster of players.
      Returns:
      reserveRoster the reserves

    • getOpponentRoster

      Returns:
      opponentRoster ArrayList of opposing athletes

    • setOpponentRoster

      public void setOpponentRoster(ArrayList<Athlete> opponents)

      public void totalGamesPlayed()

    • canCompete

      public boolean canCompete()
      This method checks if the player can still compete in matches If the starting lineup does not contain 5 players with stamina then the player cannot compete in a match.
      Returns:
      boolean

    • checkAthletePositions

      public void checkAthletePositions()
      This method goes through the active roster and finds the athlete playing each position.

      Returns:

    • promoteAthlete

      public void promoteAthlete(Athlete athlete, String position)
      This method removes a particular athlete from reserves and adds them to the main roster.
      Parameters:
      athlete - the player being promoted
      position - the position they're being assigned to play

    • demoteAthlete

      public void demoteAthlete(Athlete athlete)
      This method removes the specified athlete from the main roster and changes their position to "Unassigned". They are then added to the reserve roster.
      Parameters:
      athlete - the Athlete being demoted

    • draftMainAthlete

      public void draftMainAthlete(Athlete athlete, String position)
      This method is used for purchasing athletes from the market and adding them to the starting lineup directly. It assigns a position, adds athlete to main roster, changes money and then removes this athlete from the list of athletes on the market.
      Parameters:
      athlete - the Athlete purchased
      position - the Athlete's purchased

    • draftReserveAthlete

      public void draftReserveAthlete(Athlete athlete)
      This method adds an athlete from the market to the reserves. Then the player's money is deducted by the athlete's contract price. Next this athlete is removed from the list of athletes for sale on the market.
      Parameters:
      athlete - Athlete

    • purchaseItem

      public void purchaseItem(Item item)
      This method adds an item to the player's inventory and deducts the price from their money. After the purchase the item is removed from the list of purchasable items.
      Parameters:
      item - the Item being purchased

    • sellAthlete

      public void sellAthlete(Athlete targetAthlete)
      This method sells athletes by increasing the player money by the athletes sellback price. Then they will be removed from whichever roster contains them.
      Parameters:
      targetAthlete - the Athlete being sold

    • sellItem

      public void sellItem(Item item)
      Increases the player's money by the item's sell price and then removes it from inventory.
      Parameters:
      item - the Item being sold

    • getMarketAthletes

      public ArrayList<Athlete> getMarketAthletes()
      Return the list of Athletes available on the market.
      Returns:
      marketAthletes ArrayList of the Athletes for sale

    • setMarketAthletes

      public void setMarketAthletes(ArrayList<Athlete> marketAthletes)
      Sets the list of Athletes available on the market.
      Parameters:
      marketAthletes - an ArrayList of Athlete objects

    • getMarketItems

      public ArrayList<Item> getMarketItems()
      Return the list of Items available on the market.
      Returns:
      marketItems an ArrayList of Item objects

    • setMarketItems

      public void setMarketItems(ArrayList<Item> marketItems)
      Set the list of items available on the market
      Parameters:
      marketItems - an ArrayList of Item objects

    • getWeeklyMatches

      public ArrayList<Match> getWeeklyMatches()
      Return the list of weekly matches that can be played in the Stadium.
      Returns:
      weeklyMatches an ArrayList of Match objects

    • setWeeklyMatches

      public void setWeeklyMatches(ArrayList<Match> matches)
      Set the list of weekly matches that can be played in the Stadium.
      Parameters:
      matches - an ArrayList of Match objects

    • getPossibleItems

      public ArrayList<Item> getPossibleItems()
      This method adds all the possible Items into an ArrayList and then returns it. Used to get the Items for sale on the Market.
      Returns:
      items ArrayList of Item objects

    • refreshWeek

      public void refreshWeek()
      This method is used when the player takes a bye to refresh the game logic for the week. It refreshes the list of taken names that will be checked during athlete generation. It generates and sets a new list of athletes for the market, and matches for the stadium.

    • refreshTakenNames

      public void refreshTakenNames()
      This is called every week to update the list of taken names. When athletes are generated, they check this list to prevent duplicate athletes.

    • greatlyIncreaseStats

      public void greatlyIncreaseStats(Athlete athlete)
      When the player takes a bye they get the option to train one of their athletes. This method increases each of their stats by 2.
      Parameters:
      athlete - the Athlete to increase the stats of

    • useItem

      public void useItem(Athlete athlete, Item item)
      The player can use Items on their Athletes in the Inventory screen. Each Item can increase a specific stat. When this method is called the items are removed and a partiucular stat of the Athlete will be increased.
      Parameters:
      athlete - the Athlete to increase the stats of
      item - the Item to use on the Athlete

    • rosterWarnings

      public void rosterWarnings()
      Updates roster-related warnings in the ClubScreen This method exists to prevent make changing the label more convenient.

    • determineBestAthlete

      public void determineBestAthlete()
      The Athlete with the highest number of matchup wins will be the player's best Athlete. Matchups refer to the comparison between two athletes in the same position during a match between teams. This method determines which athlete in the player's club has won the most of these. They will be displayed in the end game summary.

    • getBestAthlete

      public Athlete getBestAthlete()
      Used in the EndScreen to get and display the best Athlete.
      Returns:
      bestAthlete the athlete with the most highest matchup wins

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main method. Begins the game by calling launchStartScreen();
      Parameters:
      args - array of command-line arguments for the application
